Date: Thu, 13 Aug 2020 21:06:24 +0000 
Thank you so much for handling!! 
From: 
Sent: 
Subject: RE: delivery of hard drive to MDC for discovery production to inmate 
I just sent the next round of discovery via FedEx. The password for this drive is 
the password in a separate envelope. 
Please let us know when it arrives. 
Thank you, 
From: 
Sent: on ay, ugus , : 
We also sent a letter with 
Subject: Re: delivery of hard drive to MDC for discovery production to inmate 
That should be enough to track it down, thank you! If I have any issues, let you know. 
Best 
8/10/2020 5:59 PM >>> 
I sent this via FedEx. When I enter the tracking number it says: 
Delivered 
Friday 8/07/2020 at 7:16 am 
Let us know if you have any other questions. 
Thanks! 
Sent from my iPhone 
EFTA00026711

On Aug 10, 2020, at 5:48 PM wrote: 
Good evening 
Just confirming - did you use FedEx, USPS, or some other carrier to send the discovery here? I have not received it yet, but 
it could just be that staff did not notify me a package arrived. Depending on the carrier, it could be in the warehouse or 
mailroom, so I just want to verify so I can find it expeditiously. 
Thanks! 
8/5/2020 7:13 PM > » 
That's extremely helpful, thanks so much. We II plan to put the drive in the mail tomorrow, and of course please let us 
know if any issues arise. 
thanks again, 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, August 05, 2020 19:05 
suoject: Kt: delivery or nara anve to nnix. tor aiscovery production to inmate 
Hard drives should be mailed to the facility to the attention of the legal department. We need to etch the drive with a 
number and provide an authorization memo so she can retain it. Then it will be provided to her. It can be password 
protected so long as you include a cover letter that contains the password for her. 
"iris helps, 
8/5/2020 4:34 PM > » 
We have a hard drive with loaded discovery that we need to deliver to Ghislaine Maxwell, at MDC. Could 
you please let us know what the current protocol is for that? Also, it's our understanding t  a ar rives with discovery 
materials for inmates needs to be non-encrypted (and not have a password for access), is that also correct? 
We're hoping to get these materials to her tomorrow if at all possible, so we greatly appreciate your help. And I'm 
reachable any time at-if it would be helpful to discuss. 
thanks, 
Assistant U.S. Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
EFTA00026712
